intro: Agrostophyllum flexuosum subsp. peloricum, commonly known as the peloric agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
